President Trump: s tweet on the same day, stating that the stock market has hit a new high with the longest winning streak in decades, and expressing confidence and optimism even before the tax plan rollout.
The analysis reported by CNNMoney and Ma: which confirmed that all three major stock indexes (Dow Jones Industrial Average, Standard & Poor's 500, and Nasdaq Composite Index) closed at record highs for five consecutive days on February 15.
The expert opinion of Sam Stovall: chief investment strategist at CFRA Research, who stated that President Trump deserves credit for the stock market highs due to his promised tax and regulation cuts, although it is not the sole driver of the market's performance.
